alert.note: Alert for Delta; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued December 14 at 4:16PM EST until December 16 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A long period of strong southerly winds, and waves building to 6 to 9 feet in the Bay of Green Bay and to as high as 15 feet on Lake Michigan, leading to significant lakeshore flooding. * WHERE...Southern Schoolcraft and Delta Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Some roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Significant shoreline erosion is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The areas most likely to see lakeshore flooding and significant beach erosion will be those exposed to a south-southwest wind.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
